boardgame.name: Aqua Romana
boardgame.description: Loosely translated from the website:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The citizens of the early Roman empire lack a substantial part of life: drinking water._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Experienced architects and their workers take up the challenge and build the monumental Roman water system: the aqueducts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;It's not always easy, since the architects need to oversee many building sites at one time. Therefore, not all water pipes can be completed._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Plan ahead such that your workers build the longest aqueducts to earn the most fame at the end._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Aqua Romana is a tile laying game for 2 to 4 players. During his turn a player can extend an aqueduct, close an aqueduct and earn points for closed aqueducts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;To extend an aqueduct, the player chooses a worker and the corresponding architect, play the corresponding tile, move the workers forward and move the architect ahead._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;An aqueduct is closed when it ends at the side of the gameboard or a non-fitting neighboring tile._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A closed aqueduct yields 1 point for every tile it is long. If an aqueduct crosses a tile for the second time, it yields two points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when no tile can be played for an entire round. Winner is the player with the most points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2006 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #17 - I Coulda Been a Contenda!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: never played +++++ german version. game components are completely language independent and a rules translation is available on boardgamegeek already +++++ will be shipped with insurance +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia or australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for other non-euro-countries : cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : cash (by letter) or bank transfer (wich by the way is cost-free !) +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ foreign buyers beware : german postal sadly is very expensive for foreign packages (about 18 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped and the weight), pleask at for shipping prices, before you buy !) +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros, including insurance

Queen Games - Aqua Romana Language: Dutch - English - French - Italian - German - Spanish 2 to 4 players 8 year and older Duration: 45 to 60 min New - mint condition - unopened - still in shrink wrap. Weight: 1,485 kg Theme: The young, up-and-coming Roman kingdom needs a wide variety of things, but the one thing the big towns need above all others is drinking water. So experienced master builders and diligent workmen set about errecting mighty aquaducts to provide the people with water. Use your skill to make sure that your workmen have access to the necessary master builders at all times and are able to build the longest water system. However, all your achievements will receive less attention if the other players manage to transport the same amount of water to the town. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.
